integration

Class LineStatement

  • java.lang.Object
    • integration.LineStatement

  • public class LineStatement
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to transform statements in a CSV file to statements in RDF.
    A CSV file must contain the following 5 columns :
    • contextName
    • eventName (eventType)
    • dateStart of the event
    • predicateName
    • value
    The value of each column is checked during initialization of the object.
    One statement by line in the CSV file == one instance of LineStatement created for each line Method getStatements returns a RDF statement
    Author:
    cossin

    • Constructor Detail

      • LineStatement

        public LineStatement(java.lang.String line,
                     java.lang.String columnSeparator)
              throws UnfoundEventException,
                     UnfoundPredicatException,
                     InvalidContextException,
                     java.text.ParseException,
                     UnfoundTerminologyException
        Parameters:
        line - A line of a CSV file for example
        columnSeparator - Columns separated by
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if dateString not valid
        UnfoundEventException - if event not described in the ontology
        UnfoundPredicatException - if predicate not described in the ontology for this event
        InvalidContextException - if contextName format is incorrect
        UnfoundTerminologyException - if predicate is an objectProperty and instance is not found in terminology

      • getStatements

        public java.util.Set<org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.Statement> getStatements()
        If the predicateName is a time Ontology predicate (hasBeginning, hasEnd), 4 statements are returned
        Otherwise, one statement is returned
        Returns:
        RDF statements
